content: लता [लत्-अच्] {@--1@} A creeper, creeping plant; लताभावेन परिणतमस्या रूपं <ls>V. 4</ls>; लतेव संनद्धमनोज्ञपल्लवा <ls>R. 3. 7</ls>. Often used as the last member of compounds, especially with words meaning ‘arm’, ‘eyebrow’, ‘lightning’, to denote beauty, tenderness, thinness &c.; भुजलता, बाहुलता, भ्रूलता, विद्युल्लता; so खड्ग°, अलक°, &c.; <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Ku. 2. 64</ls>; <ls>Me. 47</ls>; <ls>Ś. 3. 15</ls>; <ls>R. 9. 46.</ls> {@--2@} A branch. {@--3@} The creeper called {%Priyaṅgu%}. {@--4@} The Mādhavī creeper. {@--5@} Musk-creeper. {@--6@} A whip or the lash of a whip. {@--7@} A string of pearls. {@--8@} A slender woman. {@--9@} A woman in general. {@--10@} The Dūrvā grass.
